camel.sink.path.command.name: camel.sink.path.command
camel.sink.path.command.description: What command to execute such as blobstore or compute. One of: [blobstore] [compute]

camel.sink.path.providerId.name: camel.sink.path.providerId
camel.sink.path.providerId.description: The name of the cloud provider that provides the target service (e.g. aws-s3 or aws_ec2).

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.container.name: camel.sink.endpoint.container
camel.sink.endpoint.container.description: The name of the blob container.

camel.sink.endpoint.group.name: camel.sink.endpoint.group
camel.sink.endpoint.group.description: The group that will be assigned to the newly created node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

camel.sink.endpoint.hardwareId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.hardwareId
camel.sink.endpoint.hardwareId.description: The hardware that will be used for creating a node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

camel.sink.endpoint.imageId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.imageId
camel.sink.endpoint.imageId.description: The imageId that will be used for creating a node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

camel.sink.endpoint.locationId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.locationId
camel.sink.endpoint.locationId.description: The location that will be used for creating a node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

camel.sink.endpoint.nodeId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.nodeId
camel.sink.endpoint.nodeId.description: The id of the node that will run the script or destroyed.

camel.sink.endpoint.nodeState.name: camel.sink.endpoint.nodeState
camel.sink.endpoint.nodeState.description: To filter by node status to only select running nodes etc. One of: [PENDING] [TERMINATED] [SUSPENDED] [RUNNING] [ERROR] [UNRECOGNIZED]

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: Specifies the type of operation that will be performed to the blobstore.

camel.sink.endpoint.user.name: camel.sink.endpoint.user
camel.sink.endpoint.user.description: The user on the target node that will run the script.

camel.component.jclouds.blobStores.name: camel.component.jclouds.blobStores
camel.component.jclouds.blobStores.description: To use the given BlobStore which must be configured when using blobstore.

camel.component.jclouds.computeServices.name: camel.component.jclouds.computeServices
camel.component.jclouds.computeServices.description: To use the given ComputeService which must be configured when use compute.

camel.component.jclouds.lazyStartProduce.name: camel.component.jclouds.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.jclouds.lazyStartProduce.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.jclouds.basicPropertyBin.name: camel.component.jclouds.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.jclouds.basicPropertyBin.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
